definition[0]: the act of forcing someone to leave a place
example[1]: his expulsion from the Soviet Union in 1964
definition[1]: the act of stopping someone from going to the school where they were studying or from being part of the organization where they worked
example[2]: The headmaster threatened the boys with expulsion.
example[3]: the expulsion from the party of its former leader
definition[2]: the act of forcing air, water, gas etc out of something
definition[3]: when someone is forced to leave a place or an organization
example[4]: Bankruptcy results in instant expulsion from the group.
example[5]: Companies which seriously breach the code face expulsion from the association.
